Easily accessible off of the most touristy section of Barcelona (Las Ramblas) I was a bit skeptical, but this street (Pintor Fortuny) is quite the gold mine and Bar Lobo is no slump.  After brunch and a wander through the Raval a couple of friends and I weren't ready to go home so we stopped into Bar Lobo for a couple of cortados and a slice of chocolate cake to split.  The cake was absolutely delicious; dense and rich to the extreme.  I have since returned to sit in the cushy banquettes along the window to read a book and have another dessert which was also quite nice.  The space is large and the lighting is great, interesting design and a great mix of internationals and a few locals as well.  Prices are a little expensive but this isn't a bad spot to unwind or chat with friends, the food is better than average (and the desserts are great) and the atmosphere is quite enjoyable.  The music is also up my alley (Electric Guest, Cat Empire and more).  Good stuff!
